originalTitle: Kenyan charged with luring young men to fight for Russia in Ukraine
title: Kenyan charged with luring young men to fight for Russia in Ukraine
content: A total of 1,000 Kenyans have reportedly been recruited to fight for Russia in its war against Ukraine.

originalTitle: Girl, 14, shot dead as South Africa's 'taxi wars' hit school
title: A Sad Story in South Africa: Keeping Our Schools Safe
content:
Hello, My Little Friends!

Hi everyone! It's me, your friendly news reporter from Africa. I'm here to talk about something very important today. Sometimes, news can be a little bit sad, but it's important for us to learn about what's happening in our big, beautiful continent. We always want to hope for the best and work for peace.

What Happened in South Africa?

Today, we are talking about a country called South Africa. It's a really special place, full of amazing animals and kind people, just like where you live! But something very sad happened there recently. A young girl, just 14 years old, was hurt very badly. She was near her school when some grown-ups were having a big argument.

Schools Should Be Safe Places

Schools are places where we go to learn. They are places for laughing with our friends, drawing pictures, reading books, and playing games. Schools should always be safe. They should be far away from any kind of trouble or fighting. But this time, the grown-up trouble came too close to a school. This made many people very sad, especially the little girl's family and friends. We all want schools to be safe havens for learning and fun.

What are 'Taxis'?

Did you know that in many parts of Africa, people use special big cars to get around? They are called taxis! But not just any car. In South Africa, many taxis are big vans or minibuses. They can carry many people at once. These taxis are very, very important.

Why are Taxis Important?

Imagine your mom or dad needs to go to work. Or maybe your older sister needs to go to high school far away. Or maybe someone needs to go to the market to buy food. These big taxi vans help people get where they need to go! They take people to their jobs, to school, to the shops, and to visit family. They are like busy little bees, always moving around and helping people. Many people use them every single day.

Did You Know?

Did you know that in South Africa, many people call these special vans "minibus taxis"? They are a very important way for millions of people to travel every day. They are like big, shared cars for the community!

Grown-ups and Taxi Routes

Now, here is where the sad part comes in. The people who drive these taxis, and the people who own them, work very hard. They earn money to buy food for their families, just like your parents or guardians do. But sometimes, these grown-ups have big disagreements. They argue about who gets to drive on which roads, or who gets to pick up people from certain places. These roads and places are called "routes."

What are 'Taxi Wars'?

When grown-ups fight a lot over these taxi routes, people call it "taxi wars." It's not a real war with soldiers, but it's very serious. It means that sometimes, people get very angry. And when people get very angry, they can do things that are not good. They might shout, or argue, or sometimes, very sadly, they might even hurt each other. This has been happening for a very, very long time – even before your parents were born!

Why Do They Fight?

It's because making money from taxis is a very important job. It helps many families. So, everyone wants to have a good route, where they can pick up many people and earn money. But there are only so many routes and so many people to pick up. This can make people feel like they need to fight for their share. It's a bit like if all your friends wanted to play with the same toy, and there was only one toy. But grown-ups should know how to share and talk about problems, not fight.

The Danger Near Schools

This time, the fighting came too close to a school. A school is a place where we should feel super safe. We should never have to worry about grown-up problems when we are learning. When the fighting happened, the little girl was just going about her day. It was very scary for everyone, and she got badly hurt. This is why we must always say: STOP the fighting!

What Can We Do?

It's very important that grown-ups find peaceful ways to solve their problems. Fighting never helps. It only makes people sad and scared. The police and other leaders in South Africa are trying their best to help. They want to make sure everyone is safe, especially children. They are talking to the taxi drivers and owners. They want everyone to agree on fair rules so that no one has to fight anymore.

Did You Know?

Did you know that South Africa is a very big country at the bottom of Africa? It has eleven different official languages! That means many people speak different languages there.

Our Hope for Peace

We all wish for peace. We want every child in South Africa, and all over Africa, to feel safe at school, at home, and when they are playing outside. We want the taxi drivers to be able to do their important jobs without any trouble. We want them to share and work together like a team.

Let's Be Kind

Even though this is a sad story, it reminds us to be kind to each other. When we see someone sad, we can try to make them smile. When we have a problem with a friend, we can talk it out instead of shouting. Grown-ups need to learn this too! Let's hope that the grown-ups in South Africa will find peace very soon. They must remember that children need safe places to grow and learn.

Working Together for a Safe Future

Everyone needs to work together. The taxi drivers, the owners, the police, and the government leaders. They must all sit down and talk. They must find ways to make sure that these important taxis can help people get around, but without anyone ever getting hurt again. Especially not near our precious schools. Our future depends on us learning to live in peace and harmony.
summary: A 14-year-old girl was sadly hurt when grown-ups fighting over taxi routes brought trouble too close to a school in South Africa, reminding us why schools must always be safe places for children.
whyMatters: This story matters because everyone, especially children, deserves to be safe at school and everywhere, and grown-ups must find peaceful ways to solve their problems instead of fighting.

originalTitle: Is Ethiopia heading back to war in Tigray?
title: Is Ethiopia heading back to war in Tigray?
content: Many people are again leaving the region of Tigray just over three years after the civil war there ended.

originalTitle: India and Israel pledge to boost cooperation on trade, defence
title: Friends Across the Ocean! India and Israel Work Together!
content:
Hello, super friends! It's your kid-friendly news reporter from sunny Africa! I'm here to share some exciting news from far, far away. Did you know that countries can be friends, just like you and your buddies? Well, two big countries called India and Israel are doing just that! They are promising to help each other even more.

Meet Our Friends: India and Israel!

Let's learn about these two amazing places. First, there's India! India is a very big country in Asia. It has lots of people and many beautiful things. Like colorful festivals and yummy spicy food! Did you know? India is famous for making lots of movies, called Bollywood movies! They are full of music and dancing. And then there's Israel. Israel is a country also in Asia, but not too far from Africa. It's a place where many old stories come from. It's also very clever with new ideas, especially for growing food in dry places. Did you know? Israel is very good at making new technology, like parts for your phone or computer! They invent many cool things.

What Does "Work Together" Mean?

When countries 'work together' or 'cooperate', it's like when you and your friend team up for a school project. You help each other. You share ideas. You make things better when you work as a team! India and Israel are saying they will work together even more closely. This is like a big promise between two good friends. They want to share more and learn from each other. It helps both countries be stronger and happier.

Sharing and Trading! (Like Swapping Toys!)

One big way countries work together is by 'trade'. Trade means buying and selling things from each other. It's like if you have an apple and your friend has a banana, and you swap! Countries trade big things. They might trade special medicines, or tools for building, or yummy foods. India might sell its special spices or beautiful clothes to Israel. Israel might sell its clever farming tools or new technology to India. When countries trade, everyone gets things they need. It makes things cheaper and helps create more jobs for people! Did you know? India sends many tasty fruits and vegetables, like mangoes and tea, all over the world!

Keeping Everyone Safe (Like Brave Superheroes!)

Another important way they work together is called 'defence'. Defence means keeping people safe. Just like your parents keep you safe, countries have armies and police to keep everyone in their country safe. When India and Israel work on defence, it means they share ideas on how to keep their homes safe. They might learn from each other how to make sure bad things don't happen. They share clever ways to protect their people. It's not about fighting. It's about being prepared and helping each other stay peaceful. It’s about feeling secure. Did you know? Sharing ideas about safety helps everyone feel more secure and less worried!

Why Is This Good News for Everyone?

When countries become better friends, lots of good things can happen! They can share new ideas to fight sickness. Maybe a new medicine will be made faster because they work together! They can share ways to grow more food. This helps stop people from being hungry in both places. They can also share ideas to make the world a better, more peaceful place for all of us. Friendship between countries makes the whole world stronger, just like friendship makes your class stronger! It's a win-win for everyone.

What About Us in Africa?

Even though India and Israel are far away, their friendship can teach us something important. It shows us that when countries help each other, amazing things can happen. New ideas can grow. Maybe we in Africa can also learn from these new ideas they create together. We can find new ways to grow food or make new things. We can also make friends with countries near and far. This makes our big world a happier place! Did you know? Africa is a continent with 54 amazing countries, and they all work together too!

A Bright Future Together!

So, India and Israel are pledging to be even better friends. They will trade more things and help keep each other safe. This is great news because it means more good things for their people and for the world. More peace and more shared discoveries. It reminds us all that working together and being kind is always the best way! We can all learn from their friendship. That's all for today, super friends! Stay curious and keep smiling!
summary: India and Israel are becoming even better friends to share goods and ideas, helping each other grow and stay safe.
whyMatters: It's important because when countries are friends, they can share good things like new ideas and help each other, which makes life better for many people and helps keep the world peaceful.

title: Blood tech: UK’s use of Israeli spyware that helps underpin a genocide
content: Despite its public objections to Israel's actions, the UK is buying spyware developed and tested on Palestinians.

originalTitle: Fans of richest PL clubs pay £74 per match as ticket revenue soars
title: Fans of richest PL clubs pay £74 per match as ticket revenue soars
content: Fans of the Premier League's six wealthiest clubs are paying an average of £74 per ticket for each match they attend, while ticket revenues are soaring, according to data from a new report.
